Posts.Content: My then GYN doctor find the lump in my breast, sent me for a mammogram and ultrasound. She said both test was fine. I waited 6 more months (checking the lump regularly) before going back to the Dr. When went back to make sure that this was still fine, she examined me (that only took like a second) then she said that I needed to go see a surgeon. The surgeon did a biopsy and a few days later she called me to tell me that I had cancer. I also had it in 4 of my lymph nodes. So, please make sure that they do a biopsy on you.
Posts.Title: kinda silly question

Posts.Content: Hi Franny, My treatment was A&C and Taxol. Like what Sassy said, drinking a lot of water is the best thing she can do. Even if she isn't thirsty keep her drinking. Also she should have little snacks throughout the day. When I had my treatments I brought in a cooler that had water, cookies, crackers etc. When she get the taxol treatment her toes and fingers are going to be a little numb and tingly but unfortunately that will last for 1 year. My toes are still a little numb and my treatments were in 10/03. I too took the nausea medicine and it helped me get through the treatments. When I noticed that my hair was starting to fall out I had my hair cut very short and then I had my husband shaved the rest off. That did made it easier for me. I did wear wigs and hats because I could not (and never did) look at myself when I was bald. That was too hard for me to do. If you have anymore questions you can also email me too. Good Luck. Kathy
Posts.Title: New to this board

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy In 2003, I had the sentinel node biopsy and my surgeon took out 15 lymph nodes, 4 was positive. I had to have radiation because of that besides having chemo. I also had a mastectomy. I was progestron positive and estrogen negative. My onc doctor put me on Femara. Because of having some of my lymph nodes out I have to be very careful with that arm. I can not have blood, injection, IV and blood pressure taken from that arm ever again. I have to wear a medical alert bracelet now.
Posts.Title: Receptors??

Posts.Title: New to this board

Posts.Content: I had Neulasta 4 times after A/C treatments too. My whole body ached. It was very painful to touch any part of my body. The good thing was that it only lasted 1 day. By the next day I was fine.
Posts.Title: Neupogen

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, I am on Femara too and my onc. doctor gave me pain medicine called Ultraset. It does help a little but I can only take it at night because it makes me sleepy. I used to be on Celebrex, Viotox (sp) and bextra but I stopped taking them because of the side effects. I feel the same way, I am also 44 but feel that a very old person. Kathy
Posts.Title: Femara side effects?
